statement:
Let $X$ be a compact Hausdorff space and $C(X)$ the algebra of
continuous functions $X \longrightarrow \mathbb{C}$. Recall that $C(X)$
is a vector lattice with the usual : $f\leq g \Longleftrightarrow g-f$
takes positive (or zero) values.

$\,$

[**Theorem -** ]{} If every subset of $C(X)$ that is bounded from above
has a least upper bound (i.e. $C(X)$ is a bounded complete lattice),
then $X$ is extremally disconnected.
names: compact Hausdorff space is extremally disconnected if its function algebra is a bounded complete lattice
sufficient condition for a compact Hausdorf space to be extremally disconnected
